intro: Leptalix atrovirens, commonly known as the black-green leptalix, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its dark green foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a smooth margin, and the flowers are usually pale green to white in color. Leptalix atrovirens plays a role in supporting local insect populations and contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
